TopicTitle: RoveMax Model S2 wheels just sort of [insert verb] across the suface

Articles.Content:
I'm testing a mobile SSTO refuelling tank on Kerbin and the wheels are misbehaving. I'm not sure how to describe their behaviour so I've uploaded a video of it. They behave a little differently when the brake is applied. When I try to move forwards or backwards they just spin while it carries on moving as it was.

*I accidentally captured the music I was listening to while playing. Ignore that.

Edited April 20, 2015 by THX1138

I'm testing a mobile SSTO refuelling tank on Kerbin and the wheels are misbehaving. I'm not sure how to describe their behaviour so I've uploaded a video of it. They behave a little differently when the brake is applied. When I try to move forwards or backwards they just spin while it carries on moving as it was.

https://youtu.be/PlRg3nEfhqM

Yeah, they happen for some reason. Although, my kinda bounces across the surface, probably because your payload is heavier.
Well, I can see that the suspension on those little S2 wheels is completely maxed out, so you've overloaded them. You should move up to the TR-2L wheels instead for something that massive.
